FuncDef:
The telnet ipv6 server enable command enables the Telnet ipv6 service.
The undo telnet ipv6 server enable command disables the Telnet ipv6 service.
By default, the Telnet ipv6 service is disabled.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
You can run the telnet server enable command to enable the Telnet service. A client can connect to a remote server by Telnet only after the Telnet service is enabled on the server.
After you disable the Telnet service on the server, all clients that have logged in through Telnet are disconnected.
Precautions
When you run the undo telnet ipv6 server enable command, the IPv6 Telnet server is disconnected. You are advised to confirm whether to perform the undo operation.
STelnet is recommended for a network that has high security requirements.
